events.name: AI, Analytics and the Future of HR
events.description: Join us for an exciting meetup where we will debate how AI, analytics and automation technologies will transform the role of HR / Recruiters. At first, Dr. Vaisagh Viswanathan, CTO of impress.ai, will speak about his journey where he helped companies use AI to make better hiring decisions. Thereafter, Lina Tang, Senior Vice President of DBS Group HR, Human Capital Analytics, will talk about her experience analysing HR data of an organization with over 20,000 employees and a real use-case on Employee Productivity. This will be followed by a panel discussion. Confirmed panelists include: Leong CheeTung, CEO of EngageRocket,Daniel Kusmanto, Global Head, HR Analytics at ASM,Vaisagh Viswanathan, CTO of impress.ai,Sam Neo, Founder of People Mentality Inc We want to dedicate more time to discussion and sharing among the Data Night community. So please come armed with thoughts, questions and interesting use cases from your organization. Ecosystem Partner:BLOCK71 Singapore

events.name: Kaggle Winner Talk & Team Forming Session
events.description: A Kaggle Champion, Heng Cher Keng, will share his experience on winning the TensorFlow Speech Recognition Challenge (first place in the private leader board!). Cher Keng is an AI expert and has won multiple awards on Kaggle and other AI competitions. Challenge: https://www.kaggle.com/c/tensorflow-speech-recognition-challengeSpeaker: https://www.kaggle.com/hengck23 Agenda:6:30 pm - Door opens & networking7:00 pm - "TensorFlow Speech Recognition Challenge" Talk by Heng Cher Keng7:20 pm - Q&A session7:30 pm - Overview of the group and team forming talk by organizers7:45 pm - Team forming session8:30 pm - Door closes & further networking at BK Eating House Please kindly confirm your RSVP using the following Eventbite URL. Registration is essential for entry into the building. Thank you. https://sginnovate.com/events/kaggle-machine-learning-meetup-0.

events.name: Visual Studio Team Services in Startup - Plan, Work Together, and Ship Faster
events.description: • What we'll doIn this meetup, we are proud to have Sebastian Shen, Co-founder of Haulio (www.haulio.io), and Gigi Ling a young and passionate Graphic Designer in Haulio product development team to join us to share how a startup can make use of Visual Studio Team Services (VSTS), Microsoft Teams, and Microsoft Azure in the daily product planning, development, testing, and maintenance. AGENDA: When Startup Meets VSTS and Microsoft Team - Sebastian Shen & Gigi LingProduct planning and development is never an easy task, especially in a startup team where we have to keep on building fast and evaluating new ideas. Learn how a startup team, Haulio, use Visual Studio Team Services and Microsoft Teams to manage the work and keep track of the development and maintenance progress of their ASP .NET Core applications on Microsoft Azure. This is your opportunity, especially those who are working in a small (startup) team to learn about what VSTS can offer in your project development! Please join this meetup and and also invite your friends of friends to join this meetup. Many thanks for your support and help. Your friendly co-organizer,Chun Lin • Important to knowKindly remember to bring photo ID to get through NTUC Centre Building security at Level 1.
events.location: 22CF12, Level 22, Microsoft Singapore, Singapore 018989, One Marina Boulevard

events.name: Robotic Process Automation (RPA) with the open source TagUI RPA Tool
events.description: • What we'll doAI Singapore now maintains and develops the TagUI tool – a Robotic Process Automation (RPA) tool – which can be used for automating user interactions with web browsers or other applications. Use cases include process automation, data acquisition and testing of web apps. ​The intention is to add AI capabilities to TagUI while keeping it open-source and free to use. Key features of the tool include cross-platform implementation (macOS, Linux, Windows), integration with R & Python for big data and AI use cases, execution of automation flows in 20+ human languages or JavaScript, and visual automation with OCR support. WORKSHOP OBJECTIVEConceptually gain understanding of what RPA is all about, opportunities and challenges offered by RPA, current RPA technology landscape and where it is heading. Technically experience for yourselves RPA in action using the TagUI open-source RPA software (for people attending the hands-on, please bring along your own laptops). TARGET AUDIENCEPeople with interests in digital transformation, process improvement, engineering etc. Ideally you would have already heard about RPA (Robotic Process Automation) or Intelligent Automation. Technical experience is not mandatory, though attendees with programming experience will be able to try out more stuffs during the hands-on. PROGRAMME Overview of RPA – 20 minutesBackground, today and future of RPA – introduce what RPA is and how is it different from traditional IT or automation technologies. Elaborate how RPA works and what type of work it can be used to automate.Opportunities and Challenges – discuss why RPA now and the automation opportunities of RPA. Elaborate on both the technical and human challenges faced when trying to deploy RPA.Tools and Implementations – talk about various RPA software market leaders (Blue Prism, Automation Anywhere, UiPath, WorkFusion). Examples of companies currently using RPA. Overview of TagUI – 20 minutesIntro to TagUI – free and open-source process automation software that reads workflows in human language to perform automation. Top 3 open-source automation tools for Google Chrome. TagUI can work on macOS, Linux-based OSes and Windows laptops, unlike commercial RPA software which can only work on Windows.Automation concepts – understanding the concepts for web apps and visual automation. TagUI can also interact with desktop applications using visual recognition. Though applications are increasingly shifting to web-apps instead of traditional thick or thin client-server architectures.Workflows demos – show some sample workflows of automation in action to let attendees get an overview of what is possible using TagUI software, so that they will be able to imagine in their own context what type of processes could be automated. RPA General Q&A – 20 minutes Hands-on Session – 60 minutes(Topics: Setup, Using it, Architecture, Advance Features, Developers Reference) • What to bringIf you are staying for this hands-on session, please bring along your laptop. • Important to knowThis is a 2-parts workshop. First part is non-technical. Second part is a hands-on workshop with the TagUI tool.

events.name: Quantum Computing Meetup
events.description: • What we'll do Hello Quantumers! Our second Meetup is on Wednesday March 14th from 7:00 - 10:00pm. It will be located at Hospoda Microbrewery in 180 Albert Street (Albert Court) #01-19. The closest MRT station is Rochor (downtown line, 300m, 5 min walk). Alternative MRT stations are Little India (7 mins) and Bugis (10 mins). The folks at Hospoda (www.facebook.com/hospodamicrobrewery) have been very kind to offer to host our second meetup. They are one of the few microbreweries in Singapore, and will offer their local craft beer to us at happy hour prices for the duration of the event. Finger food is available onsite, while meals can be purchased from neighbouring eateries, and can be taken to Hospoda. There has been exciting news in the recent weeks about quantum computing, so do come down and join us for a great discussion! • What to bringYour curiosity! • Important to knowNo need to know anything about quantum physics, so don't be shy :)
events.location: Hospoda Microbrewery, 180 Albert Street (Albert Court) #01-19, Singapore

events.name: Create Video On-The-Go with iMovie iOS Workshop
events.description:
Love shooting videos while traveling? Wish to create a video that catches people's eyes? Want to learn how you can fully utilise the FREE iMovie app on your iPad or iPhone to edit your footages and tell great stories on the go? Well, this workshop is for you!




Technology nowadays have changed the way how we see and do things, it gives us the flexibility to create and express ourselves almost without boundaries in many different ways. In this case, iMovie.

Turn your videos into movie magic.
With iMovie you can enjoy your videos like never before. It’s easy to browse your clips and create Hollywood-style trailers and stunning 4K-resolution movies. You can even start editing on iPhone or iPad, then finish on your Mac. And when you’re ready to premiere your movie on all your devices, iMovie Theater rolls out the red carpet.



Make Movies Easily. From the first scene to the last.
It’s never been easier to make movies. Just choose your clips, then add titles, music and effects. iMovie even supports 4K video for stunning cinema-quality films. And that, ladies and gentlemen, is a wrap.

What you will learn
In this workshop you will learn how to import your footage, setting up project file, familiarise editing tools, combining footages, adding text and effects, audio editing, exporting and more! So don't missed out this chance to learn this amazing application.
P/S: You are recommended to download the iMovie app on your iOS devices before attending the workshop.

See ya real soon!
events.location: Switch AEON Mall Bandar Dato’ Onn, Lot F29, First Floor, Aeon Mall Kempas, No. 3, Jalan Dato’Onn, Bandar Dato’Onn,, Johor Bahru 81100
